content.description:
Start standing at the right edge of the boulder with an uneven right hand and your left hand in a good small seam. Reach out left to sidepulls, and then get your right up to a good blocky hold. Establish some good feet, and then reach up into the crack/seam at the lip. It's feeling pretty high up at this point, but you got to get your feet a little higher and then utilize a cool two finger sloper for your left hand to top out.

 There is a pretty hard sit to this climb, probably V8+.
content.protection: A pad or two. There is a decent-sized rock on the right that could come into play.
content.location: It is on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Start standing in the middle of the wall on obvious jugs. Work your way slightly right to a seam at the topout. The topout is a bit delicate and the crux.
content.protection: The landing is a bit terraced. I could see a fall from the topout resulting with a bounced landing to the bottom terrace (about an extra 3'). With a good spot, that can be avoided, and 1 pad will do.
content.location: It is smack dab in the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Beginner's Freight is a nice, overlooked boulder that climbs a little higher than it looks.
